intro: Eutrema bonplandii, commonly known as the Mexican sea blush, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers and its ability to thrive in sandy, coastal soils. Eutrema bonplandii is often found growing in dune environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing sand and preventing erosion. Its ecological importance is significant in maintaining the biodiversity of coastal ecosystems.
